newsitem.title: UK: NWE gas oil rallies with IPE, German cargo demand.
newsitem.headline: NWE gas oil rallies with IPE, German cargo demand.

text.p: NWE gas oil rallied $2-4 a tonne on Monday as healthy German demand lifted spot market premiums, magnifying a rally on benchmark IPE futures, traders said.
A 20,000-tonne part cargo of German grade heating oil due to load July 3-5 was sold at July IPE +$2.60 a tonne, basis cif Hamburg, about $1 firmer than talk on Friday.

Traders said steady interest from buyers in Europe's largest heating oil market, where cool temperatures have led to a modest increase in consumption, was combining with thin supply of Russian barrels to push premiums higher.
"Demand is there in the background, particularly into Germany, and there's not much Russian coming out at the moment," said a trader.

Prompt IPE July gas oil futures rallied $1.50 to close at $165.25 a tonne, pushed higher by stronger crude markets which were benefiting from continuing uncertainty about when Iraqi exports would resume.
The IPE gains and a strong dollar kept barge markets thin, however, with deals restricted to a couple of European diesel parcels which fetched a steady July IPE +$5.50 a tonne fob Rotterdam.
"The combination of higher futures prices, a stronger dollar/mark and rising premiums in Rotterdam means nobody is interested today," said a barge trader.
Heating oil barges were talked slightly firmer either side of July IPE +50 cents a tonne for prompt delivery with July 15-31 barrels offered at +$1.00.
